oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Carbon Nanotube-Gold Nanohybrid Catalyzed N-Formylation of Amines by using Aqueous Formaldehyde
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SHAH, N
GRAVEL, E
JAWALE, DV
DORIS, E
NAMBOOTHIRI, INN
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: gold
heterogeneous catalysis
nanoparticles
nanotubes
recyclability
AEROBIC OXIDATION
ACID-ESTERS
REDUCTIVE AMINATION
PEPTIDE-SYNTHESIS
NANOPARTICLES
FACILE
DERIVATIVES
ALDEHYDES
ALCOHOLS
PROTOCOL
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The N-formylation of a variety of primary and secondary amines by using aqueous formaldehyde at room temperature in open air affords the corresponding formamides in excellent yield under the catalytic influence of a gold-carbon nanotube nanohybrid. The reaction is also marked by excellent chemoselectivity, low catalyst loading, and recyclability of the catalyst.
